newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Wienerberger to expand Vienna office project.
newsitem.headline: Wienerberger to expand Vienna office project.

text.p: Austrian building materials maker Wienerberger Baustoffindustrie said on Wednesday it would expand its "Wienerberger City" office project in Vienna for a total cost of four billion schillings by the year 2002.

Chief executive Erhard Schaschl said plans included a new twin office tower with 45,000 square meters of space, adding to the existing 66,000 square meters in the development. It would also include 1,200 appartments, schools and sports facilities.
Wienerberger said it was seeking a financing partner for the new office tower, but declined to give further details.

"This hasn't been decided yet. But the question is whether Wienerberger shouldn't rather invest in industrial projects and leave real estate investments to a partner," chief financial officer Wolfgang Reithofer said. -- Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274
